attributes.action: Disallow RMT Strikes to be conducted on 2+ consecutive days mid-week.
attributes.additional_details: The Delay Repay Scheme SWR operate is not a simple process considering the frequency in late trains. Furthermore, repayment is minimal, approximately £3 for a one-way journey if the train is 15 minutes late, or more. As such, whomever is paid by the hour on a client basis, this repayment is not nearly enough compensation to run a business effectively. In addition, despite several complaints internally, SWR shrug their shoulders. Unfortunately neither RMT nor SWR treat customers fairly.
attributes.background: Every month, I spend £505.40 on a Monthly Rail ticket Basingstoke to Waterloo for work. On numerous occasions SWR is delayed, late or cancelled. On numerous occasions there is RMT Strike Action over consecutive days. As a result, I and several others lose time and money.

rejection.details:
It is not the responsibility of the UK Government or Parliament to set strike dates. This is the responsibility of the union taking strike action.

You could start a new petition calling for a change in the law to limit the right to strike for workers on public transport if that is something you would like to see happen.
